Description: Terracotta figure plaque, vessel or more likely stove fragment. Mould-made. Thick slip on both inside and outside. Discoloured and worn. Ridge and two applied rosettes. Red-brown Nile silt with abundant organic inclusions.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Fabric similar to Boston 86.478. Possibly a frgamnet from a local protome copy.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (LA.26) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4633 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
